flowchart
Class Procedure

java.lang.Object
  flowchart.Procedure
public class Procedure
extends java.lang.Object

An instance of a Procedure consists of a sequence of statements. The design of class Procedure is based on the Facade design pattern. An instance of Procedure can be considered as a wrapper of StatementSequence.

Version:
1.00 (Last update: June 8, 2008)
Author:
Dr. Wen-jun LI, Da LUO

Field Summary
private  java.lang.String name
          The name of this procedure.
private  StatementSequence stmtSeq
          A sequence of statements, which is represented by an instance of StatementSequence.

          Constructor for a new procedure.

paint

public java.util.List paint(int startX,
                            int startY)
Create a list of JGraph cells to represent this procedure.

Parameters:
startX - The x-coordinate of the top left corner of the flowchart.
startY - The y-coordinate of the top left corner of the flowchart.
Returns:
The list of cells as shown in a flowchart. The type of the elements in the list is DefaultGraphCell.

paint

public org.jgraph.JGraph paint(int startX,
                               int startY,
                               org.jgraph.JGraph graph)
Construct an instance of JGraph with the list of JGraph cells in this procedure.

Parameters:
startX - The x-coordinate of the top left corner of the flowchart.
startY - The y-coordinate of the top left corner of the flowchart.
graph - The reference to an instance of JGraph which has been created.
Returns:
The reference to the instance with the list of cells.
